meanings.sent1: The compressive force of the machine made the metal flat.
meanings.sent2: The compressive strength of the material helped it withstand heavy loads.
meanings.sent3: The compressive hug from her friend was so tight, she couldn't breathe!
meanings.sent4: The compressive weight of responsibilities felt like a heavy burden on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The compressive grip of the vise made it impossible to open.

meanings.sent1: The compressive material could be folded into a small package.
meanings.sent2: The compressive nature of the sponge allowed it to shrink when squeezed.
meanings.sent3: The compressive pillow magically reduced in size when she sat on it.
meanings.sent4: The compressive spring could be pushed down and then bounce back up.
meanings.sent5: The compressive bag could hold a lot of items when pressed tightly.

meanings.definition: Exerting pressure or force to reduce size or volume
meanings.sent1: She had to compress the clothes to fit them all in the suitcase.
meanings.sent2: He used a vacuum bag to compress the blankets for storage.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to compress the large balloon into a tiny one.
meanings.sent4: The chef needed to compress the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to compress his gear into a small backpack for the race.
